Review:
Aroma: No

Appearance: Quite little head, clean gold colour

Taste: Salty, hazy sweet of malts, no hop-bitter

Palate: Light body, thin texture, fizzy carbonation and little flat sweet finish of malts

Overall: Disappointed, just like sparkling water.

Review: Can, many thanks to Bruce..... It pours pale yellow with a small white head. The nose is dull sweetness, cereal, dough and paper. Review: Bottle at Bruceâ€™s. Fuck yeah, I finally get the South Korean pale lager rate Iâ€™ve always wanted. The pourâ€™s very light gold with a tight creamy white head. Actually not an unattractive pour. The nose is banana, golden syrup, skunky grain. The taste is lemon squash. Bread. More grain. Little else. Maybe some yellow apples. Light body, quite fizzy. Overall, not great. Still, thereâ€™s no truly objectionable flavors.

Review: Can at Bruceâ€™s on the opening evening of Jackâ€™s Farewell Tour in London - massive thanks to Bruce. Pours perfectly clear yellow with a lasting, frothy white head. Light dry cereal on the nose, some hay. Light sweet flavor, delicate dough, hay, cereal, crispy white bread. Light bodied with average, creamy carbonation. Light sweetness to finish, mellow bitter straw, dry dough. A restrained pale lager - rare indeed. Good work, South Korea.

Review:
355ml can (Anywhere, Suwon)

Pale and fizzy. Light fruity esters in the retronasals. Carbonation obvious in the taste. Less crappy than the Cafri, but getting there - itâ€™s desperately watery. Some unpleasant sharp aspects, sourish. A bit nasty in the finish. However, I am parched, so I am going to finish the can (1/3rd of the way round the Suwon fortress walk on a hot day - need fluids!)

Review: Cann, 33cl. Clear blond coloured with some light carbonation and a medium but diminishing white head. Stranger malty sweet almost veggy hinted aroma. On the verge of becomming unpleasant. Medium palate. Finish is wattery with a metallic sweet malty background. Absolutely nothing.

Review: 0.33l bottle shared with ClubGonzo and Inbreak. A golden clear beer with a small quickly fading bubbly almost transparent head. The aroma is not way to nice. Old and dusty hops, a hint of sour and perhaps also some wet skunk here. Average carbonated and it has a watery to soft oily mouthfeel. Thin and blend flavors. Itâ€™s lagerish - just a bit more watery. Somewhat dry in the mouth before it ends with a hint of fruity yeast and melon zest. Really boring. 04.01.2012

Review: Can, courtesy of Palme and shared with Bergen Beer Geek Tasting Crew. Clear golden body, big foamy white head. Nose is rotting vegetables, grain, paper and pale malts. Meh. A watery palate brings out bleak pale malt tones with hints of syrup and dusty hops. A classic crap Asian lager.

Review: 33 cL can. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is cornish, grassy and hayish. Cornish and slight grassy finish. Ends dry and bitter finish.

Review: Can. A yellow beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of malt, straw, and a bit of metal. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw, metal, and lemons, leading to a dry, metallic finish. The body is watery. Thanks Papsoe for sharing.

Review: Can 35,5 cl. Clear yellow with a white head. Fresh fruity nose. Body is very thin and watery, no malt to speak of and a heavy metallic note. Somewhat dry finish where I believe I can detect a little hops too. 141111

Review: Can: Poured a golden clear with a huge white fluffy head. Aroma is sweet harvest. Taste is soft grain and fresh, very mellow and not bad for a can. This is a nice beer for being light.
